intro: Isolepis gracilis, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and dense, cylindrical clusters of spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as bogs and shallow water areas. Its flowering structures, called spikelets, contain small, wind-pollinated flowers. Isolepis gracilis plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
